explanations.machine learning: The paper employs several machine learning models (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost, Random Forests) for predicting precious metal index.
explanations.supervised learning: The study uses supervised learning techniques for predicting price percentage changes of precious metal index.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The K-means method, an unsupervised learning technique, is used for label segmentation.
explanations.classification: The price percentage changes are categorized into five distinct labels, indicating a classification task.
explanations.regression: Predicting the price fluctuations of precious metals can also be viewed as a regression problem.
explanations.decision tree: Random Forests, which are based on decision trees, are one of the models used in the study.
explanations.clustering: K-means clustering is employed for label segmentation.
